definitions.definition: To violate rules in order to gain advantage from a situation.
definitions.example: My brother flunked biology because he cheated on his mid-term.

definitions.definition: To be unfaithful to one's spouse or partner.
definitions.example: After he found out his wife cheated, he left her.

definitions.definition: To manage to avoid something even though it seemed unlikely.
definitions.example: He cheated death when his car collided with a moving train.

definitions.definition: To deceive; to fool; to trick.
definitions.example: He cheated his way into office.

definitions.definition: An act of deception or fraud; that which is the means of fraud or deception; a fraud; a trick; imposition; imposture.
A card game where the goal is to have no cards remaining in a hand, often by telling lies.
A hidden means of gaining an unfair advantage in a computer game, often by entering a cheat code.
